title: SW System Verification Engineer
description:
**Let's create the future together.**


At Volvo Cars, we believe that being curious and truly committed to understanding people is the key to future success. We are people who care about other people, working together to create new technologies and innovations for safe, sustainable and convenient mobility. Want to join us?

  


#### **Software Analyze Engineer**

#### **Safe Vehicle Automation -** **Together we make a difference.**


Our unit Safe Vehicle Automation develops and delivers leading Safety and Autonomous Driving. We even control the vehicle’s 6 degrees of freedom of movement in the most energy efficient way, creating a rewarding and confident drive and ride experience.


Our purpose is to develop and deliver Vehicle Motion and Control, ADAS, Highway Pilot, HPGNSS and Protective Safety.


#### **What we offer:**


In our Art within Safe Vehicle Automation, we are a team of dedicated and skilled engineers creating tomorrow’s platform solutions for our vehicles. We deliver a platform with high performance sensors enabling AD&ADAS, HPGNSS and Protective Safety functionality.


Development of:


* High Precision Global Navigation Satellite System
* Supplementary Restraint System and sensors with integrated Pedestrian protection
* Interfaces to realize our functions: Airbags in all positions, Belt systems both reversible & irreversible, Battery disconnection, Vehicle motion control and related functions, Cloud service.


We are now looking for Software Analyze Engineer with focus on system/component and software testing.


Join our journey in creating the world-class platform that will enable delivery of **High Precision Global Navigation Satellite System (HPGNSS).** You will have a once-in-a-lifetime chance to make an impact in solving the “engineering problem of the century”.


#### **What you will do:**


You will be a member in one of our Engineering teams which consist of system design engineers and analyze/test engineers.


Your main responsibilities will be system verification and develop automated test methods/cases of HPGNSS, as well as to report to management, cooperate with other Engineering Departments, Production and facilitate integration testing.


Skills in different SW analyze tools and verification are fundamental knowledge, and you are also expected to contribute to our new architectural SW development for our ART Protective Safety in general.

  


#### **What you bring in:**


You are a technically oriented person with an interest in development and automotive, you enjoy being part of a team, you thrive in working in a collaborative environment and building networks across the organization and you are a self-motivated person who wants to see results in your own work as well as the teams’.


**Main responsibilities:**


* To be an active team member of the scrum team.
* Lead and responsible for system analysis, testing and verification, alignment and reviews of product design, implementation, and delivery plan.
* Developing test cases and automate them, continues delivery/update to CI (Continuous Integration) chain.
* Fault tracing and analysis, create and follow up fault-report.
* Part of the system design and write/update/improve requirements, and system safety related work.
* Supplier & integration test lead, technical reviews lead.

  




**Required qualifications****:**


* M.Sc or B.Sc in Computer Science, Electronics or automotive industry related.
* 3 + years of work experience within automotive (equivalent areas) testing or development.
* Experience in testing and analysis in CI automated testing and Python. C++ is a plus.
* Familiar with TCP/IP and AUTOSAR standard, especially diagnostic part.
* Experience in using Vector products as CANoe or CANApe & vTeststudio, familiar with CAPL.
* Capability to work with SW architecture and understand the SW design.
* Have a driving license.
* Plus: Experience ECU extract and signal database/interface.
* Plus: Experience of GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite System).
* Plus: Experience of CAN/LIN/FlexRay, logging tools/equipment (Wireshark, SmartLogger, ViGEM etc.)
* Plus: Experience of Volvo tools Carweaver, Elektra. If involved in Volvo SW development of VCU as a designer, developer, or tester.
* Fluent in English (written and spoken). As we are a truly international team.
* Plus: Swedish Driver license B.

  




**Do you fit the profile?**


* You have a positive mind-set.
* Personally, you are a true team player.
* Ability to independently develop, plan, conduct and follow up work towards objectives.
* Dedication for technique, analysis, our products, and customers.
* Good communication and cooperation skills are crucial to succeed.
* We also see that you are curious and continuously searching for new knowledge.

  




**How to learn more and apply:**


If you have any questions regarding the position, you are welcome to contact the hiring manager Arash Houshmand (email: arash.houshmand@volvocars.com).


Regarding the recruitment process, please contact Senior recruiter Neha Mehta via email: neha.mehta@volvocars.com.


Please apply no later than May 30th, 2024. But note that selections will be running continuously.


Please note that due to GDPR, application through e-mail is not accepted.


**Who are we?**


Everything we do starts with people. Our purpose is to provide freedom to move, in a personal, sustainable and safe way. We are committed to simplifying our customers’ lives by offering better technology solutions that improve their impact on the world and bringing the most advanced mobility innovations to protect them, their loved ones and the people around them.

  

  

Volvo Cars’ continued success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. The people of Volvo Cars are committed to making a difference in our world. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with over 40,000 employees across the globe. We believe in bringing out the best in each other and harnessing the true power of people. At Volvo Cars your career is designed around your talents and aspirations so you can reach your full potential. Join us on a journey of a lifetime as we create safety, autonomous driving and electrification technologies of tomorrow.
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Test Developer
description:
Job description
  
Job Description
  
  

We are seeking a skilled and motivated Test Developer to join our team at Amaris Consulting. This role is perfect for those with 4-6 years of experience in the field and who are looking for an opportunity to apply their skills in a dynamic, international environment. It is an exciting opportunity to work on our new platforms and gain insights into the entire system behavior. The position is based in Sweden and will be on an Undetermined Duration Contract basis.
  
  

As a Test Developer, you will be an integral part of our agile team, focusing on automation testing and fault tracing. You will work hands-on with test automation and rigs, contributing to the development and validation of our cutting-edge technologies.
  
  

Develop and execute automated tests to ensure the quality and reliability of our systems.
  
Perform fault tracing and debugging to identify and resolve issues.
  
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate testing into the development process.
  
Work with tools such as Jenkins, Git, Gerrit, CAPL, Robot Framework, CANoe, and vTest Studio.
  
Apply Basetech concepts, including network management, diagnostic concepts, and software downloads, in testing scenarios.
  
Utilize configuration management skills to maintain and control software versions and configurations.
  
Apply knowledge in diagnostics and communication protocols to enhance testing processes.
  
About You
  
  

We believe you are a proactive and creative team player who enjoys collaborating with your agile team. You are a problem solver, structured, enthusiastic, self-driven, and results-oriented. You possess strong communication and analytical skills and are willing to share your experiences and take lead and responsibility.
  
  

Strong test mindset and experience in automation testing.
  
Proficiency in Git, Gerrit, Python, and CAPL/C.
  
Experience in testing and fault tracing in vehicle testing environments.
  
Good programming skills in general.
  
Familiarity with tools such as Jenkins, Robot Framework, CANoe, and vTest Studio.
  
Knowledge of Basetech concepts (network management, diagnostic concepts, software download).
  
Experience with configuration management practices and tools.
  
Understanding of diagnostics and communication protocols.
  
What can you expect?
  
  

Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability or other characteristics.
  
  

Who are we?
  
Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7500 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.
  
  

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:
  
  

**Brief Call:** Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!
  
  

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!
  
  

**Case study:** Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.
  
  

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.
  
We look forward to meeting you!

title: Jr. Software Engineer
description:
Job Title: Junior Software Engineer  

Location: Sweden, Hybrid  

  

Purpose of Role:
As a Junior Software Engineer in the Intelligent Process Optimization team at Weir, you will enter the world of mining, Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT), machine learning, cloud, and software engineering. Your contributions will have global impact.
In this role, you will be working in a cross-functional agile team, to build and maintain software for a process optimization product written in Python and Go. You will work closely with a senior software engineer and gradually get responsibility and ownership as you gain experience, skill, and confidence in our mission, technology stack, and system design.
We value transparency, diversity, and continuous learning. You should be open to new ideas, eager to explore and adapt to new technology, share lessons learned and progress with the team, and be comfortable with asking for help.  

  

Why choose Weir:  

Be part of a global organization dedicated to building a better future: At Weir, the growing world depends on us. It depends on us constantly reinventing, quickly adapting and continually finding better, faster, more sustainable ways to access the resources it needs to thrive. And it depends on each of us doing the best work of our lives. It’s a big challenge – but it is exciting.  

  

An opportunity to grow your own way: Everything moves fast in the dynamic world of Weir. This creates opportunities for us to take on new challenges, explore new areas, learn, progress and excel. Best of all, there is no set path that our people must take. Instead, everyone is given the support and freedom to tailor-make their own career and do the best work of their lives.  

  

Feel empowered to be yourself and belong: Weir is a welcoming, inclusive place, where each individual’s contribution is recognized and all employees are encouraged to innovate, collaborate and be themselves. We continually focus on people and their wellbeing. We believe in fairness and choose to be honest, transparent and authentic in everything we do.  

  

Key Responsibilities:* Design, implement, and deploy APIs written in Python and Go in accordance with best practices.
* Learn and apply application security best practices.
* Collaborate with Data Scientists to integrate new features into the product.
* Collaborate with API consumers, such as frontend developers, to enable use, capture feedback, and manage changes to the system.
* Apply software design patterns and code quality best practices.
* Effectively communicate intent, progress, and results to the team.
* Demonstrate 100% commitment to our zero harm behaviors in support of our drive towards developing a world class safety culture.

  

Job Knowledge/Education and Qualifications:* A bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent work experience.
* Demonstrable experience developing software using Git and DBMS.
* Demonstrable understanding of high-level machine learning terminology and concepts.
* Familiarity with Linux-based systems and tools.
* Experience with IoT and the mining industry is considered a plus.
* Experience working with data scientists and machine learning is considered a plus.
* Experience working in an agile team using a tool like JIRA is considered a plus.
* Experience with Azure and containerization (e.g. Docker) is considered a plus.

  

Founded in 1871, Weir is a world leading engineering business with a purpose to make mining operations smarter, more efficient and sustainable. Thanks to Weir’s technology, our customers can produce essential metals and minerals using less energy, water and waste at lower cost. With the increasing need for metals and minerals for climate change solutions, Weir colleagues are playing their part in powering a low carbon future. We are a global family of 11,000 uniquely talented people in over 60 counties, inspiring each other to do the best work of our lives.  


  

*Weir is committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.*

title: DevOps Engineer
description:

Division (Weir ESCO, Weir Minerals, etc): Minerals  

Location: Sweden, Hybrid  

  

Purpose of Role:
As a DevOps Engineer in the Intelligent Process Optimization team at Weir, you will embark on an exciting journey at the forefront of technology. Your expertise, combined with our team’s diverse experience in mining, IIoT, cloud technology, and software engineering, will have significant global impact.
In this role, you will design and manage our cloud-based infrastructure on Azure and Kubernetes, ensuring that our systems are secure, robust, and scalable. You will collaborate closely with Data Scientists and developers to drive continuous improvements to security, quality, and observability throughout the continuous delivery lifecycle.  

  

Why choose Weir:  

Be part of a global organization dedicated to building a better future: At Weir, the growing world depends on us. It depends on us constantly reinventing, quickly adapting and continually finding better, faster, more sustainable ways to access the resources it needs to thrive. We continually focus on people and their wellbeing. We believe in fairness and choose to be honest, transparent and authentic in everything we do.  

  

Key Responsibilities:* Foster security and quality throughout the continuous delivery pipeline.
* Define and deploy application infrastructure on Azure and Kubernetes using IaC.
* Collaborate with developers and Data Scientists to promote DevOps and configuration management best practices.
* Continuously explore, evaluate, and share knowledge on emerging technology.
* Write scripts that interact with Azure, Kubernetes, GitHub, and other services to enable builds, deployments, and testing of software.
* Study and apply best practices from Azure and the Kubernetes community.
* Design and maintain application deployment interfaces used by developers and Data Science
* Drive compliance, application observability and DevOps KPI tracking through standardization and tool introduction.
* Demonstrate 100% commitment to our zero harm behaviors in support of our drive towards developing a world class safety culture.

  

Job Knowledge/Education and Qualifications:* A bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent work experience.
* Experience working with common Azure services and Infrastructure as Code.
* Experience in building CI&CD pipelines and introducing tools to improve security and code quality.
* Experience working in an agile team using tools like JIRA.
* Familiarity with application observability standards and tools (e.g. OTel, Grafana).

title: AI Programmer, Combat - For an ARPG with an Indie studio...
company: Game Boost - Home of Remote Game Gigs
description:
**Game Boost**
--------------

### **Leveling Up Game Production Everywhere!**


We provide remote-friendly studios and game dev contractors together.


Freelancers, Consultants, Indies, and WFH-Studios are matched with AA/AAA, Indies, and financially backed scaling studios, looking to boost their current game projects.

*Also, we're building our presence on socials as well, so feel free to check us out on* *LinkedIn**, or* *Facebook*

 **Mission brief:**


You'll join a squad of 5 programmers collaborating across borders in this remote-friendly studio, where your fellow tech peers are located in Ukraine, Iran, Canada, and Tunisia.


This indie studio has around 40 people in total and is located in the Nordics, Finland.


They are working on a next-gen ARPG/RPG and now they need *you*, their very first AI Programmer, to support them in creating stellar combat experiences including characters, creatures, weapons and magic.

  

Think Elden Ring to get a vibe of what they are going for here, inspiration-wise.

 **Details:**

* Start: *ASAP*
* Duration: 4 months initially, possible extension up to 1 year
* Occupance rate: 100% assignment (Full-time)
* Work set-up: Remote From Anywhere
* Rate: 20-22 Euros/hour ex. vat (possible raise after 2 months)

**Your player profile:**

* You are an experienced Programmer with at least 5 years of experience from programming roles in the games industry, working at least 3 years as an AI Programmer
* Your experience includes developing AI's for combat (creatures and characters)
* C++ and UE5 feels like your home base and is where you have the most experience
* You enjoy the remote work lifestyle and are a collaborative and open person who finds solutions and common ground when working in a distrubuted team

  

Bonus:

* Experience with developing fantasy action role-playing games

 **Traits:**

  

Being humble, collaborative, and open-minded will take you a long way and is a good foundation, even if we do understand that you possess a lot more personal attributes.

 *Note:*


We believe that the world of gaming can and should include everyone.

*Neither Game Boost, nor our clients tolerate toxic, intolerant behavior* ️

**How to Play!**


It's quick and simple since we aim for low manual data entry!


This means that you can use your LinkedIn or upload a profile of your liking, fill in a couple of choice questions that will help us get to know you, and also understand basics like when you're available and what kind of projects you could be a match for.


That's it.


Buzz: Game Project, Assignment, Gig, Creator, Developer, Contractor, Freelancer, Self-employed, Consultant, Work-For-Hire, Programmer, Scripter, Software Engineer, Unreal Developer, C++, UE4, UE5, Computer Games, Steam, PC, Console, RFA, Hitmarker

title: Test Automation Engineer
description:
### **We are Fatshark**


We are a critically acclaimed Swedish game development studio with about 180 experienced and skilled employees. We are most well-known for developing the Warhammer: Vermintide franchise, but have also helped develop a number of AAA titles and we launched the highly anticipated game Warhammer 40,000: Darktide.


We have grown quite a bit over the last few years and are almost two-hundred “Sharks” now, but we still embrace the same values that we started with. Come into our world, a world known for our crazy internally designed socks, hackweeks, and Friday afternoons for studio-wide “social play” time. It all adds up to an approachable, fun, passion-driven yet communal environment for us to work in.

### **The role**


Fatshark is looking for a skilled Test Automation Engineer that will further improve on how we work with automated testing.


As a Test Automation Engineer you will be a part of our Builds and Automation team, a team of developers dedicated to making sure we can ensure regular, stable releases, where potential bugs and errors are found as early as possible using automated tests. You will have a great impact in setting the routines in how we tackle every day challenges revolving quality of our games and managing continuous testing as well as testing gameplay in tight collaboration with our internal Projects, QA, Engine, and Tools teams.


Today we make these automated tests with our own test frameworks using Lua and Ruby for Stingray (our in-house game engine) projects and C++ and C# for Unreal Engine projects. There are parts of our testing processes that need to be automated, and this is where you come in as a test automation engineer setting up the foundation for test automation and supporting our gameplay coders to add more automated testing.

### **What we offer**


Here at Fatshark, we do what we love most: design high-profile games for PCs and consoles. We offer you:

* A playful, friendly and inclusive work place
* Hands-on production environment with an emphasis on cooperative/multiplayer games
* Opportunities for personal growth with varied projects, experienced co-workers and recurring hack weeks
* Developing games with our own engine - Stingray
* Regulated flex time and paid overtime
* Occupational pension
* Health benefits and health check ups
* Bonus program
* Dog friendly office located in central Stockholm

### **What you'll do**

* Continuously improve our test automation systems
* Implement and manage various automated functional tests
* Solve challenging problems both on your own and as a part of the team
* Be a link between project, QA and Central Tech teams
* Selflessly share knowledge with colleagues
* Actively engage and suggest improvements on the way we work

### **Required qualifications**

* Professional programming experience
* At least 2+ years experience working with test automation
* Experience using either C++, C#, Lua or equivalent programming languages
* Higher education / Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent
* Strong knowledge of English, both written and spoken
* As a person - you are proactive, flexible, and organized, you enjoy collaborating with others and also know how to give and receive constructive feedback

### **Bonus qualifications**

* Experience with CI/CD systems such as Jenkins, Teamcity, and/or GitLab
* Knowledge of agile workflows and scrum
* Experience working as a team lead/scrum master, or equivalent
* Used version control systems before, such as Git, Perforce, or SVN
* Worked previously with game development for PC and current generation of consoles
* Knowledge from other parts of games development, production, and/or publishing
* Like dogs

### **Application details**


We are following the policy of working 4 days in the office per week, with 1 day option to work from home. The onboarding is being done fully in the office.


We look forward to review applications and will be interviewing candidates continuously until the position has been filled.

**Location:** Stockholm (on-site)  

**Start:** ASAP 2024  

**Form of Employment:** permanent, full-time

title: Utvecklare till gymnasieskolan
description:
Brinner du för strategiskt arbete och utvecklingsfrågor? Som utvecklare erbjuds du en varierande vardag med goda samarbeten och stora möjligheter. Tillsammans gör vi skillnad och når våra mål!
  

  

Gymnasie- och vuxenutbildningen består av 7 kommunala gymnasieskolor och Västerås yrkeshögskola. I verksamhetsområdet finns även två kommunala vuxenutbildningar. Inom våra skolor finns drygt 4000 elever och studerande och arbetet utförs av cirka 600 medarbetare. Verksamhetsområdet leds av verksamhetschef, rektorer, biträdande rektorer, enhetschefer och utvecklingsledare.
  

  

Läs gärna mer på: http://www.vasteras.se/barnochutbildningsforvaltningen


**Arbetsuppgifter:**
Som utvecklare inom Västerås stads gymnasieverksamhet arbetar du i en politiskt styrd miljö samt i en komplex organisation. Som utvecklare är du en del av verksamhetschefens ledningsstöd och du har varierade arbetsuppgifter. I uppdraget ingår det hantering av myndighetsbeslut, driva och skriva utredningar och ta fram beslutsunderlag. Du är en viktig del i det systematiska kvalitetsarbetet inom verksamhetsområdet med ansvar för uppföljning och verksamhetsrapportering. En annan del av uppdraget består av att leda eller delta i olika former av processer för att utveckla verksamheten mot uppställda mål. I detta arbete ingår samverkan med olika aktörer och professioner, internt och externt. För att skapa god samverkan behöver du ha god samarbetsförmåga och prestigelöst förhållningssätt i kontakten med andra människor.


**Kvalifikationer:**
Arbetsdagen är varierad och oförutsägbar och det är det viktigt att kunna anpassa sig till olika situationer och krav som kan uppstå. Du har god förmåga att organisera och planera dina arbetsuppgifter samt hantera flera uppdrag och uppgifter samtidigt. Du tänker hel före del och har ett strategiskt perspektiv på frågor. Du har en högskolexamen med en passande inriktning.
  

Arbetet passar dig som har intresse för att förbättra och utveckla kommunal verksamhet, processer och rutiner för myndighetsutövning.
  

  

Andra viktiga förutsättningar för att lyckas i uppdraget är en god analytisk förmåga för att identifiera mönster som en del i att utvärdera och förbättra verksamheten. Du har även goda kommunikationsfärdigheter i skrift och tal som du använder för att producera och presentera beslutsunderlag och utredningar av olika slag. I det dagliga arbetet är du van att hantera verksamhetsledningssystem vid kommunikation, uppföljning och dokumentation.
  

  

Vi utför urval och intervjuer löpande så tveka in med att skicka in din ansökan

##### **Erfarenhet:**


Ingen erfarenhet krävs


**Övrigt:**
Välkommen till Västerås stad - Västmanlands största arbetsgivare. Vi är 11 000 kollegor som tillsammans får en hel stad att fungera. Vi vet att det är i våra möten vi kan göra skillnad, oavsett om det är i våra verksamheter eller digitalt. Därför är vår värdegrund Alltid bästa möjliga möte en viktig del i vårt uppdrag. För att få en stolt och välfungerande stad och nå vår vision om staden utan gränser vill vi också att våra medarbetare ska spegla mångfalden i samhället.
  

  

Läs mer om möjligheter, karriärvägar och om vårt erbjudande:
  

https://www.vasteras.se/jobbochkarriär
  

  

I samband med intervju behöver du styrka ditt medborgarskap. Det kan du göra med pass alternativt personbevis tillsammans med ID-handling. Om du inte är medborgare i Sverige, EU, EES eller Schweiz måste du uppvisa att du har ett giltigt arbetstillstånd eller är undantagen från skyldigheten att ha arbetstillstånd. Anställning kan ske först efter kontroll av arbetstillstånd, vilket krävs enligt utlänningsförordningen.
  

  

Alla erbjudanden om rekryterings- och annonseringshjälp undanbedes.


**Anställningsform:**
Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning  

Omfattning: Heltid  

Varaktighet: Tillsvidare  

Tillträde: Tillträde enligt överenskommelse
  

Antal platser: 1

 **Ansökan:**
Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-06-05


Arbetsgivarens referensnummer: 2024/00322


**Upplysningar lämnas av:**
Stefan Remne
  

Verksamhetschef Gymnasieskolorna  

Telefon: 021-39 20 99  

E-post: stefan.remne@vasteras.se  

  

Fredrik Follmer  

Ansvarig rekryterare
  

Telefon: 021-39 39 73  

E-post: fredrik.follmer@ vasteras.se

  

Tillbaka

title: Testare och/eller testledare
description:
Nytt år, nya möjligheter… Är det först nu den tanken har landat och slagit rot? Vore det skönt att börja med något nytt efter semestern? Då är det hög tid att sätta i gång den processen nu. Och varför inte göra det hos oss på Nexer? Ta chansen att bli en del av något större och väx tillsammans med oss på Nexer!

  

Vi på Nexer är medvetna om att vi lever i en föränderlig tid men vi ser förändring som något positivt. För Nexer är varje utmaning en möjlighet och som konsult hos oss kommer du få utveckling genom dessa möjligheter, både inom olika tekniker och olika branscher.


I rollen som konsult hos Nexer får du en stabil och trygg anställning samtidigt som du får möjlighet att testa och utveckla din kompetens i olika uppdrag. Vi tror på en långsiktig och hållbar anställning där vi lägger stor vikt vid både kompetensutveckling och work life balance.

**Vem är du?**


Vi ska nu stärka upp teamet med fler konsulter inom testautomation och testledning.

**Som utvecklare inom test och testautomation** arbetar du med att säkerställa mjukvarans kvalitet genom att skapa automatiserade testfall, bygga och optimera integrations- och byggflöden samt utveckla organisationens arbetssätt kring CI/CD. Du har förståelse för/kunskap inom en eller flera tekniker och testverktyg som t ex Jenkins, Selenium, Shell Scripting eller Docker för att nämna några. Som scriptspråk hanterar du Python, C, C++, C# och/eller Java.

**Som testledare** planerar du testarbetet, skriver testplaner, prioriterar arbetet, säkrar upp resurser till testuppdraget samt följer upp och förbättrar testprocessen. Du kommer också att koordinera testarbetet och sköta teamuppföljningen. Du är van att leda och ansvara för både större och mindre testprojekt samt är van vid agila metoder så som Scrum.


Att du behärskar både svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift är ett krav.

**Vilka är vi på Nexer i Skövde?**


I Skövde har vår konsultverksamhet funnits sedan 2012. Kontoret ligger mitt i centrum och består idag av 20 fantastiska medarbetare. Hit är du alltid välkommen, om det så är för att sitta i en lugn miljö och arbeta eller ta en kaffe med en kollega.


Vi är måna om att du ska trivas hos oss och vi värnar om en långsiktig anställning. Vi värdesätter balansen mellan arbete och fritid högt då vi är övertygade om att arbetet blir både roligare och mer givande om livspusslet går ihop. För oss är det viktigt att du känner dig som hemma och att du är välkommen precis som du är!


Som konsult hos Nexer har du möjlighet att påverka din utveckling där vi utgår från vad DU vill göra, både nu och framåt. Du får också möjlighet att arbeta i både spännande och utmanande kunduppdrag för att ge dig möjlighet att utvecklas.


Våra kunder finns inom både offentlig och privat sektor. Flertalet av våra kunder inom privat sektor finns inom automotive, retail och automatiserad industri. Du utför uppdraget antingen på plats hos kund, i våra egna lokaler eller hemifrån, ofta i en hybridkombination. Vårt upptagningsområde är Skövde med omnejd.


Om du gillar spännande och utmanande uppdrag, umgås med trevliga kollegor och samtidigt utvecklas i din yrkesroll då kommer du att passa in hos oss på Nexer i Skövde.


**Ansökan**


Du är varmt välkommen att söka tjänsten genom att skicka in din ansökan här nedan. Enligt GDPR hanterar vi inte ansökningar via e-post men har du frågor om tjänsten eller Nexer är du välkommen att höra av dig till ansvarig rekryterare, Petra Sivefäldt, på petra.sivefaldt@nexergroup.com.


Vi tar emot ansökningar löpande så vänta inte med att söka!


Läs mer om Nexer här


www.nexergroup.com

title: CI engineer
emails: karin.blell@aurobay.com, clara.pryde@aurobay.com, joakim.dahlin@aurobay.com, hakan.modigh@aurobay.com, fredrik.fantenberg@aurobay.com, marko.borg.peltonen@aurobay.com
description:
**CI engineer**


*Aurobay* *has over* hundred years of heritage in creating premium quality engines. With homes in Sweden and China, we have a strong reputation for pioneering practices in the automotive industry. We pride ourselves in our attention to detail and commitment to excellence.


We're dedicated to revolutionizing how software is built and delivered, utilizing cutting-edge technologies like Zuul from OpenStack, Git and Gerrit. As part of our team, you'll shape the future of our software factory, ensuring that every member of our organization can deliver top-quality software efficiently.


**What we offer**  

  



**In addition to a competitive salary,** a great location on Lindholmen or Skövde, and a genuine work-life balance, we provide the following benefits:


* A yearly wellness contribution of SEK 5 000 for your physical and mental wellbeing.
* A personal and professional development scheme to support your growth.
* Additional pension funding.
* Competitive additional and full coverage insurance.

**Skills and Experience**


* Master's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or equivalent.
* Proven experience with CI/CD systems.
* Background in DevOps engineering.
* Familiarity with Azure cloud infrastructure.
* Strong skills in Python, Git/Gerrit, Ansible, Docker, Linux.
Experience with Matlab, SIL, and model-based systems (Simulink/TargetLink).  
* 

  

**Your role at** **Aurobay**

**As a CI engineer you will:**


* Develop and enhance our CI/CD build chain and associated processes to maintain optimal software quality.
* Manage and update existing scripts and tools to accommodate the evolving software landscape.
* Identify and implement new tools and scripts to empower our developers.

**Equal opportunities employer**


We are an equal opportunities employer. We encourage candidates from underrepresented groups to apply, especially women, people from ethnic minority backgrounds, and people with disabilities. Research has shown that women and people from ethnic minority backgrounds are less likely to apply if they don't match 100% of the criteria. As a company, we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment. If you believe you have the skills and passion to excel in this role, we would love to hear from you. Let's explore the possibilities together.


**How to apply**

Deadline to submit your application is 7th of June but the selection process will be running continuously. Please note that due to GDPR, we do not accept applications via email.
  

We can’t wait to see what you can bring to our team!


**Questions**
  

If you have any additional questions regarding the position, you are welcome to contact recruiting manager Karin Blell, karin.blell@aurobay.com


For questions regarding the recruitment process please contact Recruiter Clara Pryde, clara.pryde@aurobay.com

title: Software Developer - Data Engineering
description:
***Data, just as safety, is key for how Zenseact develops software for self-driving cars. Gb/s streams in cars quickly accumulate to petabytes of data in our data centers. The challenge of handling and processing this vast amount of data is immense — this is where you come in.***

#### **Insights from the team**


In team Totoro, we build Zenseact’s data infrastructure. We focus on data pipelines for ingestion, transfer, and messaging across our data toolchain.


As an autonomous team, we have the freedom and trust to make decisions about our products and our way of working. We readily involve our System Architect, Product Owner, and Engineering Manager in strategic discussions or if we require assistance driving an initiative. We are constantly adapting our way of working to increase our speed and achieve our goals. Within our team, we have an open and social environment - collaboration is a key value for us.

#### **Your mission and day-to-day tasks**


Join our data processing and high-performance computing groups, where you will have an important part in strengthening the Zenseact data platform. Your responsibilities will include:


* Developing custom data toolchains in Python and deploying them to Kubernetes clusters.
* Evaluating, deploying, and tailoring standard off-the-shelf tools and frameworks to fit our unique environment.
* Collaborating closely with teams and partners to boost the functionality and efficiency of our data platform.

#### **What's in it for you:**

* Influence the product direction and work in a dynamic industry with a life-saving mission.
* Shape your role based on your competencies and interests.
* Work in a global environment with people from diverse backgrounds.
* Enjoy a flexible work approach and a good work/life balance.

#### **Qualifications & experience**

**Essential experience**

  

* Proven experience in software development.
* Proficiency in a Linux environment.
* Experience with Python programming.
* Knowledge of containerization platforms like Docker.

  

You are an easygoing and open-minded individual who thrives in a collaborative environment. You bring a high level of motivation and commitment to your work, always eager to share your knowledge and experiences with your team. Your effective communication skills enable you to effectively solve problems in a team setting. You value responsibility and take ownership of your tasks, ensuring that you contribute positively to the team's goals and the overall growth of our projects.

**Nice to have**




* Experience with Kubernetes and cloud technologies.
* High skills in shell scripting and POSIX-based file systems.
* Knowledge of relational and non-relational databases, preferably PostgreSQL and Elasticsearch.
* Experience creating pipelines using orchestration tools like Apache Airflow.


Join us at Zenseact and be a part of revolutionizing the future of autonomous driving through innovative data solutions.

#### **More about Zenseact**

 **Our software makes a difference.**  

Using AI-based technology to create the ultimate driver support, we’re fighting to end car accidents and make roads safe for everyone. Every year, around 1,4 million people die in traffic while approximately 50 million people get injured. Many get disabled as a result of their injury. We can do better.

**One purpose, one product.**  

We’re a software company dedicated to revolutionizing car safety. By designing the complete software stack for autonomous driving and advanced driver-assistance systems, we’re fighting to end car accidents and make roads safe for everyone. Zenseact was founded by Volvo Cars, and the teams are based in Gothenburg, Sweden, and Shanghai, China. When we aim for zero accidents faster, we strive to speed up the transition to safe automation. This is essentially achieved by making cars updatable – like a computer or a phone. With regular software updates, a vehicle can be made safer long after its production. By accelerating improvement loops, shortening development cycles, and deploying high-capacity software quickly, we can make cars safer, and faster.

**Culture with people at heart**  

To achieve our mission of saving lives and ending traffic accidents we must go where nobody has before. It requires us to venture into the unknown, pioneering new technology and pushing the frontier of autonomous driving. While there’s no denying our determination and expertise, we must stand united to succeed. By fostering a culture of support and enablement – a place of psychological safety where all of us can thrive – everything else will follow. We call this a **people-at-heart culture.** This culture means caring. It means the company cares about me, and we care about one another. It means sharing, so we give each other energy and have fun together. Our culture is also about belonging. It’s important to feel at home and that we can be ourselves at work. Finally, a people-at-heart culture means well-being. So, we enjoy the flexibility needed to be and do our best – at work and in life.

*Zenseact works proactively to create a culture of diversity and inclusion, where individual differences are appreciated and respected. To drive innovation we see diversity as an asset, which means we value and respect differences in gender, race, ethnicity, religion or other belief, disability, sexual orientation or age, etc.*  

  

*Interviews are held continuously, so we highly recommend that you submit your application at your earliest convenience.*

title: Lead SW Developer Infotainment Display Drivers
description:
We're running an exciting mission. The mission developing the Android Infotainment Platform for current and upcoming Volvo, Polestar and other Geely brand cars.


### **More about us**

 **We are now looking for a Lead Software Developer** within our R&D department, to be a leader in the development of cutting edge displays for the next gen Android.


As a Lead Developer at HaleyTek you will be a software developer in a development team so you need competence and experience from C++ development and unit/component testing in an embedded Linux/QNX environment. Proven experience in performing board bring-ups and debugging hardware and serial communication is considered a plus.


You will also be part of our Lead Developer Community, contributing to improvements and innovation within developer tools, methods and architecture.

 **You and your skills**


You are a true leader who is motivated by challenging tasks, have a personal interest in technology and love to make the best software product out there. You are passionate about bringing the best out of others and feel comfortable in mentoring and coaching.


You need a strong technical competence within embedded development related to Android and device drivers as well as leader abilities to mentor your team to success. You like to see the whole picture and have an overall understanding of the complete system. You will collaborate with our external suppliers and partners as well as the car factory to achieve the goals.

 **Our culture**

 *As a flat organization we build an accountable culture that enables the teams to influence, and makes quick decisions and actions possible. Everyone is willing and able to pitch in and do hands on jobs when needed. In line with this, you will also have the opportunity to influence the development of this role.*


*We are a professional, energetic and friendly team, working in a modern office at the waterfront of Lindholmen, Göteborg. Our developers are working with cutting edge equipment and advanced hi-tech computers.* *We offer competitive benefits, such as maximum taxfree* *fitness allowance.*

 *If you believe that work should be fun and that a workplace should be defined by inclusion, diversity and an open-minded, ‘in it together’ mentality*

#### **Come and join us on our journey! Become a HaleyTek:er!**

 *Please note that due to* ***GDPR*** *regulations* ***we can only accept applications and CV's sent through the recruitment system****, not via email or other channels.*

title: JAVA DEVELOPER
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**
-------------------


Exciting times at Sigma Technology Digital Solutions! We are therefore looking for more colleagues to join us, who are just as curious as we are about creating innovative IT solutions focusing on digital accessibility and inclusion. Our ambition is to rethink the development process by making accessibility a cornerstone in every digitalization journey - whether we talk about user-friendliness or software development. *Curious to join us?*

title: Fullstack-utvecklare med fokus på Azure till Fellowmind
description:
*I rollen som Fullstack-utvecklare kommer du att vara en viktig del av vårt fantastiska utvecklingsteam som vi kallar vår DevStudio. Ditt huvudfokus kommer vara att vara med och ta fram enastående digitala lösningar, baserade på teknik i framkant vilket hjälper våra kunder att nå högre höjder.*

*En utvecklare hos oss arbetar med såväl nya som befintliga kunder och ser en stolthet i att leverera lösningar av hög kvalitet som skapar värde för våra kunder. Vi arbetar brett inom Microsofts teknikstack med fokus på Microsoft 365, Power Platform och Azure där just fullstack webbutveckling i Azure-stacken kommer att vara din hemmaplan!*

**Vem är du?**
--------------


Förutom att du är nyfiken på nya tekniker och vilka möjligheter det medför tror vi också att du är positiv och engagerad av naturen och villig att utvecklas tillsammans med oss på Fellowmind. Vi är övertygade om att det är när vi träffas som magi uppstår och för att passa in hos oss behöver du vara en lagspelare. Förutom detta ser vi gärna att du har följande kvalifikationer:


* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av att utveckla lösningar på Azure-platformen.
* Väl insatt, drivande och självgående inom de huvudsakliga tekniker som vi använder såsom C# och .NET för backend och React för frontend.
* Erfarenhet att jobba mot databaser (SQL)
* Du är kommunikativ och analytisk, gillar att lösa problem samt ser alltid till kundens bästa.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med pipelines i Azure DevOps och Infrastructure as Code (huvudsakligen med hjälp av Bicep och PowerShell) är ett plus men inte ett krav.

**Vad kommer du att göra?**
---------------------------

  

Som konsult hos oss kommer du att arbeta i ett team av erfarna konsulter i en miljö med en lärande och uppsökande attityd. Vi försöker hitta en jämn balans och kombinera fördelarna med att arbeta från kontoret med fördelarna att jobba på distans.


Arbetsuppgifterna består bland annat i att:  

  



* Designa, utveckla och underhålla lösningar utvecklade främst webbaserade lösningar i Azure-plattformen.
* Arbeta nära våra kunder för att förstå deras behov och erbjuda lösningar som uppfyller deras krav och förväntningar.
* Samarbeta med andra utvecklare, arkitekter och konsulter för att leverera högkvalitativa lösningar och oöverträffat värde till kunden.


Hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste trenderna och nyheterna inom utveckling och hjälpa våra kunder att ta fram innovativa lösningar som ger verksamheten värde.  

* 

**Det praktiska:**  

  

**Start:** Gärna omgående, men vi har givetvis förståelse för att du har en uppsägningstid som vi behöver ta hänsyn till.
  

  

**Omfattning:** Heltid, kontorstider, men vi är väldigt flexibla här och utgår från att det ska fungera för alla parter.
  

  

**Placering:** På vårt fina centrala Göteborgskontor.  

  

**Övrigt:** Rekryteringsprocessen kommer att bestå av telefonintervju, djupintervju, tester och referenstagning.

title: Electronics Engineer for Product Hardware Development (R&D)
description:
Job Title
Electronics Engineer for Product Hardware Development (R&D)
Job Description
Job Introduction:*At Axis Communications we are passionate about creating a smarter and safer world! Join our team and together we will innovate smart products for a greater future! Are you an electronics engineer ready for a new adventure? Join Axis at our HQ in Lund, Sweden!*  

Who is your future team?
Your future team is the System Products Electronics Team. We are a diverse team of seventeen talented and innovative electronics engineers. In our team, we work closely together, share our knowledge, and support each other in projects to develop and deliver world-class products! At System Products, we are responsible for the product areas of: Bodyworn Systems, System Devices and Recorders.  

What you’ll do here as an electronics engineer:
Most important: You are part of a team of engineers developing Axis products!  

The typical time for a project is one to two years. Together with your teammates, you are responsible for the electronic design of your product. This involves requirements analysis, concept development, analog and digital circuit design, component selection, schematic capture (using Xpedition), PCB layout supervision, prototype verification and troubleshooting (including soldering and hands-on lab work), organizing certifications and production support.  

Some examples of technologies, features and interfaces within the products we do at System Products are: audio, sirens, speakers, batteries, PoE, microphones, HDMI, USB, 4G/5G-modems, WLAN, GPS, displays, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth.  

In our project teams, we work closely with mechanical engineers, firmware developers, and many other specialists. You are an important part of the project, involved all the way from the concept phase up to when the product is delivered to the market.  

Who are you?
Do you love challenges and get excited at the thought of developing interesting products together with others? Do you feel proud when you have the finished product in your hands? Then this could be the job for you!  

We expect you to have at least a bachelor’s degree in engineering and we would be happy to hear that you have some years of electronics design and verification experience.  

We believe that you are a highly motivated and outgoing person with good communication skills. You are also able to work efficiently both individually with limited supervision as well as within a team of other highly skilled engineers.  

What Axis has to offer:
You will have great colleagues who want to succeed together with you. We learn and develop through the work with our products and are not afraid to try out new things! The role is interesting, challenging, varied, and dare we say … fun! The products you’ll be developing will help make the world a safer, and smarter place.  

Axis offers great benefits, e.g., pleasant working environments, flexible hours, Swedish “fika” every morning and Friday afternoon, physical training grants, a well-equipped gym, private health insurance and your very own Axis bicycle. From your first day, you will have a mentor colleague to help you find your way and guide you in your work here. At Axis, we also have a great introduction program for new employees.  

Ready to Act?
You are welcome to send in your application! In case of questions, please reach out to recruiting manager Maria Lindblad, +46 46 272 1800.  

Keywords: elektronikingenjör, elektronikdesign, PCBA PCB
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2024-06-10*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 4500 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast
company_description: Axis Communications is a global growth company with currently are about 4000 employees worldwide and offices in over 50 countries. We are expanding. Visit our webb page axis.com

title: Senior Devops Engineer
description:
Senior Devops Engineer


Swedium Global is the growing System Engineering and Solution Company, offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web and Cloud Application Development, Testing Services, Consultancy and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model. Swedium Global is having presence in Sweden, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic and in India.


**Location:** Sweden


**Expected Start date:** ASAP


**Job Description:** Senior DevOps Engineer


We are looking for a DevOps Engineer/Software Configuration Engineer.


**Required knowledge:**


* Help with maintenance and operations of deployment tools using Ansible


* Help to respond to and solve user tickets for your functional domain (the user base will mostly be technical; software developers and automation engineers)


* Maintain contact with other IT teams to:


o Maintain and operate the monitoring and alerting Infrastructure


* Develop new features as requested by developer communities


* Keep applications and services up-to-date by providing patches or upgrading according to a release Lifecyle


* Update documentation and support other team members with their backlog of tasks

  


**Desired skills and knowledge:**


* Problem solving attitude


* Knowledge of container orchestration tools (e.g. Kubernetes)


* Knowledge and previous experience with git distributed version control system and have worked with either GitHub, Bitbucker, Gitlab or similar web based system


* Administration capabilities of Linux based computing systems


* Knowledge of logging infrastructure such as Prometheus or Opensearch/Elastic


* Experience with automation solution for configuration management such as Ansible, Salt, Puppet or Terraform


* Comfortable with Python, bash and other shell scripting


* Good oral and written communication skills in English


The candidate should have excellent oral and written communication skills, be self-motivated, take own initiatives and pay attention to details.


**You can reach out to us at** **Pratik.pandey@swediumglobal.com** **or** **careers@swediumglobal.com**


  
Job Overview


* Location : Lund, Sweden
* Vacancy : 1
* Key Skills : Ansible, Kubernates, Python, Opensearch/Elastic, Terraform

title: Junior Application Consultant
description:
**Are you looking for a role where you can gain knowledge and experience within warehouse management solutions, working with customers in different industries? Here is an exciting opportunity!****Who we are**
Consafe Logistics is a software development company. Our product, Astro WMS®, makes the warehouse operations of logistics and supply chain companies smarter, more effective, and thus more sustainable. We’ve been in the business for more than 40 years, and we still love it! We also know that we would be nothing without our amazing co-workers, so we continuously strive to provide them with an attractive workplace with long-term development and career opportunities. Learn more about us **here.****What does a Junior Application Consultant do at Consafe Logistics?**
In this role you will have the opportunity to grow into a consultant role, working close with both colleagues and our customers. Our Application Consultants are building the bridge between our customers´ needs and our solutions. They identify customer challenges and advise which Astro WMS® functionalities would serve them best, helping them increase their efficiency with our software.
As soon as you feel comfortable you will take on more responsibility towards our customers. As an Application Consultant, you are the “voice” of customers towards your team consisting of developers, supporting consultants and project managers, ensuring that the application solution we deliver will bring the best possible value to the customer.**How would your daily work look like?**
You will work with other application consultants, developers and project managers in different teams depending on the size of the projects. You maintain close contact with our customers and continuously educate them on our software capabilities. You will collaborate with customers and your team members to define strategies and initiate projects.***Your key tasks will involve:***
Consultancy on how Astro WMS® can create the most optimal warehouse processes
Participating in workshops with customers
Participating in project go-lives on site together with the rest of the project team
Holding training sessions with Astro WMS® users
Work with technical preparation such as configurating, setting parameters as well as testing and verify the system according to the customer requirements.
**What makes you a great candidate?**
If you have a curious and proactive mindset, that´s a good start already! The thing is, we are really passionate about warehouse management and delivering smart logistics warehouse solutions for the future, so we are looking for colleagues to share this enthusiasm with.
Moreover, you might be a great fit if you:
have a relevant education, for example studies within Information Systems, Logistics/Supply Chain Management or other relevant academic degree
have a great interest for warehouse management and logistics. Maybe you have worked at a warehouse and been using some kind of Warehouse Management System before?
have a very good general IT knowledge. A technical interest and motivation for deep diving in our system is a requirement
are fluent in English, both oral and written
**What we offer our co-workers*****Professional growth:*** We are on an exciting growth journey, so your potential to have an impact and build your career within the organization is remarkable. We support your work-life balance and develop your competence according to your individual goals and needs.***Inspiring business environment:*** You will have the opportunity to work together with prominent international brands, travel, gain experience from various industries, and drive the evolution of state-of-the-art WMS solutions for the future.***A strong community:*** At Consafe Logistics, we live by our three core behaviors, *Together We Get There*, *Be Accountable and Act* and *Strive for Greatness*. We have an open and inclusive company culture, where we always find occasions to celebrate and have fun together.**Other**  

This is a full-time permanent position at one of our offices. If this sounds interesting please send in your application as possible but June 9 at latest. Selection and interviews will take place on an ongoing basis.
**Questions? Contact us!**
If you have questions about the role or the recruitment process, don't hesitate to contact Ida Krüger, Talent Acquisition Partner, at **ida.kruger@consafelogistics.com**.
We are looking forward to receiving your application

Operations
